conbody.p: For a real world example of dynamic browser-based rendering, you can point your mobile device, tablet or computer browser to the http://www.onvif.org website. It takes a bit of navigating, but if you pick a product from one of the Profile Products (Profile G is the newest), you will see a link to the ONVIF Interface Guide. This guide is required by ONVIF for all manufacturers that want to claim compliance to the standard. This guide must also conform to the DocBook standard. If you view one of these guides, you will see the information presented directly in your browser in human-readable form. If you have a way to “view source” on that document, however, you can see that it is DocBook XML – transformed directly on your client device! This project uses the same approach, but using DITA markup.
